trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with ShiftPlanning | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with ShiftPlanning | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use ShiftPlanning with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use ShiftPlanning with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and ShiftPlanning.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and ShiftPlanning.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A ShiftPlanning single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A ShiftPlanning single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to ShiftPlanning will be able to single sign into the application at your ShiftPlanning company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to ShiftPlanning will be able to single sign into the application at your ShiftPlanning company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for ShiftPlanning
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for ShiftPlanning

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for ShiftPlanning.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for ShiftPlanning.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type ShiftPlanning.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type ShiftPlanning.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select ShiftPlanning, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select ShiftPlanning, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>ShiftPlanning</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>ShiftPlanning</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to ShiftPlanning with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to ShiftPlanning with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the ShiftPlanning application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the ShiftPlanning application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to ShiftPlanning page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to ShiftPlanning page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the ShiftPlanning Sign On URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://company.shiftplanning.com/includes/saml/", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the ShiftPlanning Sign On URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://company.shiftplanning.com/includes/saml/", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at ShiftPlanning page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at ShiftPlanning page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your ShiftPlanning company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your ShiftPlanning company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click Admin.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click Admin.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Admin</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Admin</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Under Integration, click Single Sign-On.
trans-unit.target: Under Integration, click Single Sign-On.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Single Sign-On section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Single Sign-On section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select SAML Enabled.
trans-unit.target: Select SAML Enabled.

trans-unit.source: Select Allow Password Login
trans-unit.target: Select Allow Password Login

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at ShiftPlanning dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the SAML Issuer URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at ShiftPlanning dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the SAML Issuer URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at ShiftPlanning dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Remote Logout URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at ShiftPlanning dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Remote Logout URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the X.509 Certificate textbox
trans-unit.target: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the X.509 Certificate textbox

trans-unit.source: Click Save Settings.
trans-unit.target: Click Save Settings.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into ShiftPlanning, they must be provisioned into ShiftPlanning.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into ShiftPlanning, they must be provisioned into ShiftPlanning.

trans-unit.source: In the case of ShiftPlanning, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of ShiftPlanning, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your ShiftPlanning company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your ShiftPlanning company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Click Admin.
trans-unit.target: Click Admin.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Admin</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Admin</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Staff.
trans-unit.target: Click Staff.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Staff</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Staff</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Under Actions, click Add Employee.
trans-unit.target: Under Actions, click Add Employee.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add Employees</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add Employees</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Add Employees section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Add Employees section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Save Employees</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Save Employees</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Type the First Name, Last Name and Email of a valid AAD account you want to provision into the related textboxes.
trans-unit.target: Type the First Name, Last Name and Email of a valid AAD account you want to provision into the related textboxes.

trans-unit.source: Click Save Employees.
trans-unit.target: Click Save Employees.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other ShiftPlanning user account creation tools or APIs provided by ShiftPlanning to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other ShiftPlanning user account creation tools or APIs provided by ShiftPlanning to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the ShiftPlanning **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the ShiftPlanning **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
